elements.content: The reaction of copper(II) nitrate with the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp) and rigid ligand 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) affords the novel (2D + 2D + 1D) supramolecular architecture{[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1), containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other, and two different 3D coordination networks [Cu(btrp)(HSIP)] n (2) and {[Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (3) were obtained by changing the alkali or ligand/alkali ratio.
elements.clean_text: The reaction of copper(II) nitrate with the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp) and rigid ligand 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) affords the novel (2D + 2D + 1D) supramolecular architecture{[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1), containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other, and two different 3D coordination networks [Cu(btrp)(HSIP)] n  (2) and {[Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (3) were obtained by changing the alkali or ligand/alkali ratio.

elements.content: The reaction of copper(II) nitrate with the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp) and rigid ligand 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) affords the novel (2D + 2D + 1D) supramolecular architecture {[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1), containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other, and two different 3D coordination networks 2 and 3 were obtained by changing the alkali or ligand/alkali ratio.
elements.clean_text: The reaction of copper(II) nitrate with the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp) and rigid ligand 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) affords the novel (2D + 2D + 1D) supramolecular architecture {[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1), containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other, and two different 3D coordination networks 2 and 3 were obtained by changing the alkali or ligand/alkali ratio.

elements.content: Designing and synthesizing novel organic−inorganic hybrid materials have been paid much attention in recent years, because of their topology and potential applications in catalysis, adsorption (gas storage), luminescence, magnetism, etc. Thus, a great many spectacular metal−organic frameworks (MOFs) have been documented, such as one-dimensional (1D) chains and ladders, two-dimensional (2D) grids, three-dimensional (3D) microporous networks, interpenetrated modes, and helical staircase networks. Among these, particular attention has been recently devoted to systems containing entanglements of individual motifs. Besides the common types of interpenetrating networks, new more sophisticated families are now recognized, including polycatenated arrays, Borromean architectures, polyrotaxane-like species, and interlocked motifs of different dimensionality.
elements.clean_text: Designing and synthesizing novel organic-inorganic hybrid materials have been paid much attention in recent years, because of their topology and potential applications in catalysis, adsorption (gas storage), luminescence, magnetism, etc. Thus, a great many spectacular metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) have been documented, such as one-dimensional (1D) chains and ladders, two-dimensional (2D) grids, three-dimensional (3D) microporous networks, interpenetrated modes, and helical staircase networks. Among these, particular attention has been recently devoted to systems containing entanglements of individual motifs. Besides the common types of interpenetrating networks, new more sophisticated families are now recognized, including polycatenated arrays, Borromean architectures, polyrotaxane-like species, and interlocked motifs of different dimensionality.

elements.content: Conformationally nonrigid ligands showing varied geometries can more easily produce new topologies and entanglements (including polycatenanes and polyrotaxanes). We are currently investigating the use of the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)alkanes, since this spacer may give uncommon entanglements, like the widely studied flexible ligand 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (bbtz), because of its different conformations.
elements.clean_text: Conformationally nonrigid ligands showing varied geometries can more easily produce new topologies and entanglements (including polycatenanes and polyrotaxanes). We are currently investigating the use of the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)alkanes, since this spacer may give uncommon entanglements, like the widely studied flexible ligand 1,4-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene (bbtz), because of its different conformations.

elements.content: Our synthetic approach starts by focusing on the construction of new topological frameworks using flexible ligands such as 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp), due to their variety of conformations. What is more, 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) was added as the auxiliary ligand. Compared to the widely used benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid, NaH2SIP has distinctive characteristics: the weak coordination nature of -SO3 makes its coordination mode very flexible and sensitive to the chemical environment.
elements.clean_text: Our synthetic approach starts by focusing on the construction of new topological frameworks using flexible ligands such as 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp), due to their variety of conformations. What is more, 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) was added as the auxiliary ligand. Compared to the widely used benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid, NaH2SIP has distinctive characteristics: the weak coordination nature of -SO3 makes its coordination mode very flexible and sensitive to the chemical environment.

elements.content: In this communication, we describe a series of Cu(II)-SIP/btrp mixed-ligand metal−organic frameworks, which are interestingly regulated by the kind and amount of the alkali added in the synthesis route. Three novel copper(II) complexes with various topological structures, {[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1), [Cu(btrp)(HSIP)] n (2), and {[Cu1.5(btrp)2(SIP)(H2O)2]·5H2O} n (3) were fabricated and structurally characterized by X-ray single crystal analyses. 1 is particularly intriguing in that it shows a new case of polycatenation involving 1D ribbons of rings and two different kinds of 2D motifs interlaced in a 3D supramolecular architecture.
elements.clean_text: In this communication, we describe a series of Cu(II)-SIP/btrp mixed-ligand metal-organic frameworks, which are interestingly regulated by the kind and amount of the alkali added in the synthesis route. Three novel copper(II) complexes with various topological structures, {[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1), [Cu(btrp)(HSIP)] n  (2), and {[Cu1.5(btrp)2(SIP)(H2O)2]⋅5H2O} n  (3) were fabricated and structurally characterized by X-ray single crystal analyses. 1 is particularly intriguing in that it shows a new case of polycatenation involving 1D ribbons of rings and two different kinds of 2D motifs interlaced in a 3D supramolecular architecture.

elements.content: Hydrothermal reaction of NaH2SIP (0.5 mmol), btrp (0.5 mmol), Cu(NO3)2·3H2O (0.5 mmol), and LiOH (1 mmol) in a molar ratio of 1:1:1:2 at 120 °C for 3 days yielded 1, which exhibits a novel 3D network containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other. While LiOH was changed by triethylamine (NEt3) at different molar ratios, two different 3D frameworks 2 and 3 were obtained. All the crystals are stable in the air for long times, and their structures have been characterized by single crystal X-ray analyses.
elements.clean_text: Hydrothermal reaction of NaH2SIP (0.5 mmol), btrp (0.5 mmol), Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O (0.5 mmol), and LiOH (1 mmol) in a molar ratio of 1:1:1:2 at 120 °C for 3 days yielded 1, which exhibits a novel 3D network containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other. While LiOH was changed by triethylamine (NEt3) at different molar ratios, two different 3D frameworks 2 and 3 were obtained. All the crystals are stable in the air for long times, and their structures have been characterized by single crystal X-ray analyses.

elements.content: The crystal structure of 1 is comprised of three distinct and crystallographically independent polymeric motifs packed together that have the same stoichiometry. One of these motifs (part A, Figure , middle) consists of a planar 2D (4,4) network, in which there are two types of coordination environments around the copper ions (). Both Cu1 and Cu2 are six coordinated and locate in distorted octahedral coordination spheres, whereas Cu3 is five coordinated with distorted trigonal bipyramidal geometry. Both Cu1 and Cu2 coordinate with three carboxylic oxygen atoms from two different SIP ligands, two triazole nitrogen atoms from two btrp ligands, and one water molecule to form the coordination spheres. Cu3 is surrounded by four nitrogen atoms from btrp ligands and one water molecule. It should be noted that there are four independent sets of btrp spacers, which establish a physical bridge between Cu atoms. For the three sets which contain N7, N13, and N19, respectively (), all assume trans conformation and reside at crystallographic inversion centers, whereas the set to which N1 belongs adopts cis conformation.
elements.clean_text: The crystal structure of 1 is comprised of three distinct and crystallographically independent polymeric motifs packed together that have the same stoichiometry. One of these motifs (part A, Figure , middle) consists of a planar 2D (4,4) network, in which there are two types of coordination environments around the copper ions (). Both Cu1 and Cu2 are six coordinated and locate in distorted octahedral coordination spheres, whereas Cu3 is five coordinated with distorted trigonal bipyramidal geometry. Both Cu1 and Cu2 coordinate with three carboxylic oxygen atoms from two different SIP ligands, two triazole nitrogen atoms from two btrp ligands, and one water molecule to form the coordination spheres. Cu3 is surrounded by four nitrogen atoms from btrp ligands and one water molecule. It should be noted that there are four independent sets of btrp spacers, which establish a physical bridge between Cu atoms. For the three sets which contain N7, N13, and N19, respectively (), all assume trans conformation and reside at crystallographic inversion centers, whereas the set to which N1 belongs adopts cis conformation.

elements.content: Cu3 atoms are bridged by the cis-btrp to construct a wave line with a Cu···Cu distance of 10.196 Å; meanwhile, the wave line is interconnected through two sets of trans-btrp ligands and SIP ligands to yield a 1D arched chain along the a direction (Figure , top), for which has the unit of [Cu4(btrp)3(SIP)]. The 1D ladder structure (Figure , bottom) is formed through the other set of trans-btrp and SIP with the unit of [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2]. The two kinds of 1D chains are arrayed alternatively assembled into a 2D indented structure (Figure , middle).
elements.clean_text: Cu3 atoms are bridged by the cis-btrp to construct a wave line with a Cu⋅⋅⋅Cu distance of 10.196 Å; meanwhile, the wave line is interconnected through two sets of trans-btrp ligands and SIP ligands to yield a 1D arched chain along the a direction (Figure , top), for which has the unit of [Cu4(btrp)3(SIP)]. The 1D ladder structure (Figure , bottom) is formed through the other set of trans-btrp and SIP with the unit of [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2]. The two kinds of 1D chains are arrayed alternatively assembled into a 2D indented structure (Figure , middle).

elements.content: The second motif of 1 is also a planar 2D (4,4) network (part B, Figure ), in which the Cu(II) ion is in a distorted octahedral coordination sphere (). Four copper atoms, two btrp ligands, and two SIP ligands form a [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2] unit with a side of 10.196 × 12.047 Å corresponding to the a- and b-axis translations, respectively, and a diagonal measurement of 14.081 × 17.314 Å.
elements.clean_text: The second motif of 1 is also a planar 2D (4,4) network (part B, Figure ), in which the Cu(II) ion is in a distorted octahedral coordination sphere (). Four copper atoms, two btrp ligands, and two SIP ligands form a [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2] unit with a side of 10.196 × 12.047 Å corresponding to the a- and b-axis translations, respectively, and a diagonal measurement of 14.081 × 17.314 Å.

elements.content: The third motif of 1 is composed of ribbons of 20-membered cycles (part C), each ring involving two copper atoms and two btrp molecules, in which the Cu(5) atom is in a general position (). The btrp ligands exhibit a trans conformation and work as shorter spacers (N···N 7.401 Å). All these rings run parallel to a the direction, with a period equal to the a axis translation (23.362 Å), corresponding to two successive rings (Figure , bottom).
elements.clean_text: The third motif of 1 is composed of ribbons of 20-membered cycles (part C), each ring involving two copper atoms and two btrp molecules, in which the Cu(5) atom is in a general position (). The btrp ligands exhibit a trans conformation and work as shorter spacers (N⋅⋅⋅N 7.401 Å). All these rings run parallel to a the direction, with a period equal to the a axis translation (23.362 Å), corresponding to two successive rings (Figure , bottom).

Color codes: blue, N; gray, C; green, Cu; red, O; yellow, S. (bottom) The 1D ladder chain in set 1A. Color codes: blue, N; gray, C; green, Cu; red, O; yellow, S.

elements.content: The most interesting structural feature of 1 is that the two distinct and crystallographically independent 2D networks are inextricably entangled in a unique (2D + 2D) two-dimensional array (Figure ). Both sets of layers display the same (4,4) topology but exhibit quite different tiling patterns because of the varied conformations of the btp ligands. Every [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2] unit in part A locks the similar [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2] unit in part B, and all the [Cu4(btrp)3(SIP)] units in part A only constitute the edges of the 2D indented structure. Both layers A and layers B stack along the [001] direction with an ABAB sequence and an interlayer distance of 20.03 Å(1/2c). What is more, the ribbons of the third sets (part C) are linked to the 2D entanglement through weak O−H···O hydrogen-bonding interactions (O27···O10 = 2.810, O−H···O = 174.58, ) to form a 3D supermolecular structure, as shown in Figure .
elements.clean_text: The most interesting structural feature of 1 is that the two distinct and crystallographically independent 2D networks are inextricably entangled in a unique (2D + 2D) two-dimensional array (Figure ). Both sets of layers display the same (4,4) topology but exhibit quite different tiling patterns because of the varied conformations of the btp ligands. Every [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2] unit in part A locks the similar [Cu4(btrp)2(SIP)2] unit in part B, and all the [Cu4(btrp)3(SIP)] units in part A only constitute the edges of the 2D indented structure. Both layers A and layers B stack along the [001] direction with an ABAB sequence and an interlayer distance of 20.03 Å(1/2c). What is more, the ribbons of the third sets (part C) are linked to the 2D entanglement through weak O-H⋅⋅⋅O hydrogen-bonding interactions (O27⋅⋅⋅O10 = 2.810, O-H⋅⋅⋅O = 174.58, ) to form a 3D supermolecular structure, as shown in Figure .

elements.content: This compound exemplifies an extremely rare scenario where the crystal is composed of three distinct structural motifs, including two types of 2D lattices and one type of 1D chain. It is the first complex that has three motifs (2D + 2D + 1D) with different topologies in the same crystal.
elements.clean_text: This compound exemplifies an extremely rare scenario where the crystal is composed of three distinct structural motifs, including two types of 2D lattices and one type of 1D chain. It is the first complex that has three motifs (2D + 2D + 1D) with different topologies in the same crystal.

elements.content: 2 has the same stoichiometry of metal-to-ligand as 1, with the different alkali NEt3 in 2 and LiOH in 1. The crystal structure of 2 is composed of 3D frameworks with the topology of {4.62}{4.66.83} (Figure ). The coordination environment of Cu(II) ions in 2 is presented in . Cu(II) ion is six-coordinated by two carboxylic oxygen atoms and two sulfonic oxygen atoms from three HSIP ligands, two nitrogen atoms from two btrp ligands, which is in a distorted octahedral coordination sphere. It is noteworthy that two HSIP ligands bridge two Cu(II) ions with a Cu···Cu distance of 8.301 Å, which forms a dinuclear building blocks Cu2(HSIP)2. Then it can further assemble with μ4 -HSIP ligands to generate an ordered 2D grid (). Along the a direction, the 2D layer is connected into a 3D framework by the link of trans-btrp ligands. Topologically, Cu(II) ions and HSIP ligands can be defined as 5- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Consequently, the 3D-layer of Cu(II) ions can be described as a mbm type topological network with two nonequivalent points, {4.62}{4.66.83}, as shown in Figure .
elements.clean_text: 2 has the same stoichiometry of metal-to-ligand as 1, with the different alkali NEt3 in 2 and LiOH in 1. The crystal structure of 2 is composed of 3D frameworks with the topology of {4.62}{4.66.83} (Figure ). The coordination environment of Cu(II) ions in 2 is presented in . Cu(II) ion is six-coordinated by two carboxylic oxygen atoms and two sulfonic oxygen atoms from three HSIP ligands, two nitrogen atoms from two btrp ligands, which is in a distorted octahedral coordination sphere. It is noteworthy that two HSIP ligands bridge two Cu(II) ions with a Cu⋅⋅⋅Cu distance of 8.301 Å, which forms a dinuclear building blocks Cu2(HSIP)2. Then it can further assemble with μ4 -HSIP ligands to generate an ordered 2D grid (). Along the a direction, the 2D layer is connected into a 3D framework by the link of trans-btrp ligands. Topologically, Cu(II) ions and HSIP ligands can be defined as 5- and 3-connected nodes, respectively. Consequently, the 3D-layer of Cu(II) ions can be described as a mbm type topological network with two nonequivalent points, {4.62}{4.66.83}, as shown in Figure .

elements.clean_text: 3  (left) The 2D fold petetration structure of 1; color codes: pink, mode A; green, mode B; yellow, mode C. (right) Topological structure of 1; color codes: green, mode A; black, mode B; red, mode C.

elements.content: 3 is a new 3D framework self-assembled by NaH2SIP and btrp with Cu2+ salts at the condition of NEt3 with a different molar ratio as 2. The repeated unit in 3 consists of two crystallographically independent copper atoms. As viewed in , Cu1 and Cu2 are both six-coordinated in octahedral geometry. There are two independent sets of btrp spacers, which establish physical bridges between Cu atoms. For the set to which N1 belongs, the two terminal triazole groups adopt trans conformation with the N1···N6 distances of 7.917 Å between the two donor atoms. In the case of the btrp containing N7, two terminal triazole groups exhibit cis configuration with N7···N12 distances of 4.311 Å, which is the shortest distance ever observed in the btrp groups. The cis bidentate btrp molecules establish a bridge between Cu1 and Cu2 with separations of 7.004 Å, which is further interlinked by trans-btrp with Cu1···Cu2 separations of 11.008 Å to generate a 2D layer structure (). The SIP ligands adopt the two-connected mode linking 2D layers into a 3D framework (Figure ). The uncoordinated water molecules are trapped in the pores, which constitutes 16.3% of the unit cell volume. The uncoordinated water molecules form strong hydrogen bonds with the carboxylate oxygen atoms, -SO3 groups, coordinated water molecules (), which are also helpful for the stabilization of the final 3D architecture. The 3D-layer of 3 can be described as a bbf topological net with two nonequivalent points: {64.82}{66}.
elements.clean_text: 3 is a new 3D framework self-assembled by NaH2SIP and btrp with Cu2+ salts at the condition of NEt3 with a different molar ratio as 2. The repeated unit in 3 consists of two crystallographically independent copper atoms. As viewed in , Cu1 and Cu2 are both six-coordinated in octahedral geometry. There are two independent sets of btrp spacers, which establish physical bridges between Cu atoms. For the set to which N1 belongs, the two terminal triazole groups adopt trans conformation with the N1⋅⋅⋅N6 distances of 7.917 Å between the two donor atoms. In the case of the btrp containing N7, two terminal triazole groups exhibit cis configuration with N7⋅⋅⋅N12 distances of 4.311 Å, which is the shortest distance ever observed in the btrp groups. The cis bidentate btrp molecules establish a bridge between Cu1 and Cu2 with separations of 7.004 Å, which is further interlinked by trans-btrp with Cu1⋅⋅⋅Cu2 separations of 11.008 Å to generate a 2D layer structure (). The SIP ligands adopt the two-connected mode linking 2D layers into a 3D framework (Figure ). The uncoordinated water molecules are trapped in the pores, which constitutes 16.3% of the unit cell volume. The uncoordinated water molecules form strong hydrogen bonds with the carboxylate oxygen atoms, -SO3 groups, coordinated water molecules (), which are also helpful for the stabilization of the final 3D architecture. The 3D-layer of 3 can be described as a bbf topological net with two nonequivalent points: {64.82}{66}.

elements.content: In summary, three novel inoganic−organic frameworks have been constructed from aromatic polycarboxylate acid (NaH2SIP) and Cu(II) in the presence of flexible btrp-based spacers by tuning reaction conditions. The structure of 1 is very interesting; it has the (2D + 2D) type of entanglement, and moreover, it is the first complex that has three motifs (2D + 2D + 1D) with different topologies in the same structure. 2 has a compacted accumulated 3D framework, whereas 3 features a 3D hydrated framework with uncoordinated water molecules trapped in the pores. Structural analyses indicate that the difference in coordination modes of the aromatic polycarboxylic acids NaH2SIP resulting from the different kinds and amounts of base added in the synthesis process and the versatile conformation of btrp have an important influence on the resulting frameworks.
elements.clean_text: In summary, three novel inoganic-organic frameworks have been constructed from aromatic polycarboxylate acid (NaH2SIP) and Cu(II) in the presence of flexible btrp-based spacers by tuning reaction conditions. The structure of 1 is very interesting; it has the (2D + 2D) type of entanglement, and moreover, it is the first complex that has three motifs (2D + 2D + 1D) with different topologies in the same structure. 2 has a compacted accumulated 3D framework, whereas 3 features a 3D hydrated framework with uncoordinated water molecules trapped in the pores. Structural analyses indicate that the difference in coordination modes of the aromatic polycarboxylic acids NaH2SIP resulting from the different kinds and amounts of base added in the synthesis process and the versatile conformation of btrp have an important influence on the resulting frameworks.

Experiment details, TG curves, CIF files, supplementary figures and tables are available free of charge via the Internet at http://pubs.acs.org.

References

Crystallogaphic data for 1, formula: C66Cu4.5H91N36O32S3, M = 2282.91, monoclinic, P21/c, a = 10.1963(2) Å, b = 23.3619(5) Å, c = 40.0346(11) Å, β = 90.608(2) (°), V = 9535.9(4) Å3, Z = 2, 10 075 reflections out of 16 215 unique reflections with I > 2σ(I), 2.65 < θ < 25.01°, final R-factors R 1 = 0.0490, wR 2 = 0.1319. Crystallogaphic data for 2, formula: C15CuH14N6O7S, M = 485.94, monoclinic, P21/c, a = 9.795(2) Å, b = 12.732(3) Å, c = 14.262(3) Å, β = 95.68(3) (°), V = 1769.9(7) Å3, Z = 4, 2470 reflections out of 3115 unique reflections with I > 2σ(I), 2.63 < θ < 25.00°, final R-factors R 1 = 0.0361, wR 2 = 0.0814. Crystallogaphic data for 3, formula: C22Cu1.5H37N12O14S, M = 821.03, monoclinic, P21/c, a = 13.0168(18) Å, b = 15.714(4) Å, c = 16.3522(14) Å, β = 92.838(8) (°), V = 3340.7(10) Å3, Z = 4, 4229 reflections out of 5906 unique reflections with I > 2σ(I), 2.42 < θ < 25.01°, final R-factors R 1 = 0.0376, wR 2 = 0.0822. CCDC-776321 (1), CCDC-776322 (2), CCDC-776323 (3) contain the supplementary crystallographic data and can be obtained free of charge via http://www.ccdc.cam.uk/conts/retrivieving.html (or from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre, 12, Union Road, Cambridge, CB21EZ, UK; fax: (+44)1223−336−033; e-mail: deposit@ccdc.cam.ac.uk).

CCDC-776321 (1), CCDC-776322 (2), CCDC-776323 (3) contain the supplementary crystallographic data and can be obtained free of charge via http://www.ccdc.cam.uk/conts/retrivieving.html (or from The Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre, 12, Union Road, Cambridge, CB21EZ, UK; fax: (+44)1223-336-033; e-mail: deposit@ccdc.cam.ac.uk).

cln_elements.content: The reaction of copper(II) nitrate with the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp) and rigid ligand 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) affords the novel (2D + 2D + 1D) supramolecular architecture {[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]·5H2O} n (1), containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other, and two different 3D coordination networks 2 and 3 were obtained by changing the alkali or ligand/alkali ratio.
cln_elements.clean_text: The reaction of copper(II) nitrate with the flexible ligand 1,3-bis(1,2,4-triazol-1-yl)propane (btrp) and rigid ligand 5-sulfoiso-phthalic acid monosodium salt (NaH2SIP) affords the novel (2D + 2D + 1D) supramolecular architecture {[Cu3(btrp)4(SIP)2(H2O)4][Cu(btrp)(SIP)(H2O)][Cu0.5(btrp)(H2O)]⋅5H2O} n  (1), containing ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other, and two different 3D coordination networks 2 and 3 were obtained by changing the alkali or ligand/alkali ratio.

topology.condition: supramolecular architecture with ribbons of rings and two kinds of planar 2D (4,4) networks polycatenated with each other
different coordination network obtained by changing the alkali
different coordination network obtained by changing the ligand/alkali ratio

metadata.title: A New Type of Entanglement Involving Ribbons of Rings and Two Different Kinds of 2D (4,4) Networks (2D + 2D + 1D) Polycatenated in a 3D Supramolecular Architecture
